worklogs.comment:
lidavidm opened a new pull request #11640:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11640


   This fixes two issues:
   - GroupByNode would try to finish its future twice
   - GroupByNode wouldn't set the length of the key column batch, which broke down when using a scalar column as the key

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
[~thisisnic] found that this example crashes:
{code:java}
library(arrow)
library(dplyr)
write_dataset(group_by(iris, Species), "iris_data")
open_dataset("iris_data") %>%
  group_by(Species) %>%
  summarise(mean(Sepal.Length)) %>%
  collect()  {code}
There are two bugs here:
 * StopProducing is written in a way that causes a future to be finished twice, triggering a DCHECK.
 * Consume() doesn't set the length of the key column batch, causing a spurious error because the group ID datum and the values datum will have different lengths.
fields.summary: [C++] DCHECK in GroupByNode when error encountered
